title: Study for an Altar
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Pierre Puget [1620-1694], Marseille, France. Unidentified collector, France, 19th century [1]. Jacques Jérôme Marie Joseph Tardieu [1857-1944], Marseille, France [2]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, by June 12, 1974 [3]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1976.

Notes:
[1]. L. 2179a collector mark in black is stamped on the drawing (recto, lower right.) 
[2]. L. 1541a collector mark in black is stamped on the drawing (recto, lower right.) Tardieu's collector stamp appears in several other drawings that also have the unknown collector stamp in note [1] above. According to Lugt, the Tardieu collection was dispersed prior to 1963.
[3]. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute in June 1974; see curatorial file for original loan form and list of works.
